 [‹ (x) slab serif from Men's Health Magazine - Popular {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202204027/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36546 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Contemporary sans serif in Dell advertisements - Neo Tech {Thomas Binder, Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202204027/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36762 "Go to next forum topic")
author: garymilne

comments.content:
I think you are caught in the ’hand-printed font dilemma’, which means there are too many fonts like this to easily find a particular one. Your best bet is to look for one that seems similar in feeling to you and use that instead. One place to see a wide selection (which tells you where they came from) is the [Script Font ID Guide, Part 11](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202204027/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script11Pg1.html), and another place would be the free handwriting fonts at [www.dafont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202204027/http:/www.dafont.com/ "www.dafont.com").

- Mike Yanega
